newsitem.title: SOUTH KOREA: Margin loan concerns seen weighing on Seoul bourse.
newsitem.headline: Margin loan concerns seen weighing on Seoul bourse.

text.p: Persistent concerns about an overhang of huge margin loans are expected to pressure the Seoul stock market throughout Friday, and brokers said large-caps would lead the index fall.

"Possible heavy selling from margin account holders will continue to cast a gloom on the market. Without fresh money flowing into the market, consolidation will centre in large-cap shares," said Kim Wan-hee of Dongsuh Securities.
But brokers said selective small-caps would be in demand.
The composite stock index closed on Thursday 8.95 points lower to 773.15.
Brokers said selling from margin accounts would focus on shares of electric and electronics, banks, construction and securities houses.
But they said North Korean infiltration drama would have no significant impact on the market.

A North Korean infiltrator signalled he was ready to surrender after a fierce gunbattle with South troops on Friday. So far 18 of about 20 North Korean agents have been shot dead and one was captured alive.
